SUMMARY: transcription factor Cbl, for cysB like, is a regulator involved in expression of genes required for aliphatic sulfonate utilization and homeostatic response to sulfate starvation [9401024, 10506196, 8529872, 10717312, 11479697, 11918818]. Cbl does not require a ligand to binds to its DNA-binding site, but activity of this protein is negatively regulated by 5'-phophosulfate cofactor [11918818]. This protein belongs to large LysR family of transcriptional regulators and it is positively regulated by CysB, which is similar to Cbl (40% identity) [8529872, 15333946]. Members of this family have two domains, an N-terminal domain with a helix-turn-helix DNA-binding motif and a large C-terminal domain [8529872, 15333946, 17010379].
